intro: Corsia triceratops, commonly known as the three-horned corsia, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive three-horned structure on its stem. Botanically, it belongs to the family Corsiaceae and is native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. The plant features broad, waxy leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically blooming in the spring. Corsia triceratops is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in partial shade.
